revised_title: Herschel's Study on the Relative Situation of Double Stars
tldr: William Herschel examines the changes in the relative situation of double stars, focusing on the proper motion of Castor and its implications. He discusses various scenarios and their effects on the apparent motion of stars, concluding that the observed changes cannot be solely attributed to parallax or the motion of the solar system. This study contributes to the understanding of the behavior of double stars and their relative positions.
